briefTitle: The Effectiveness of High Resolution Microendoscopy for People Living With HIV
officialTitle: The Effectiveness of High Resolution Microendoscopy (HRME) in High Grade Intraepithelial Lesions (HSIL) Diagnosis for People Living With HIV

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Consentable patients with documented HIV disease
* Either: 1) previously documented HSIL or 2) abnormal anal cytology within the past 2 years
* Ages 18 years and older
* Seen at the Baylor-affiliated Thomas Street Clinic (TSC), Mount Sinai Hospital and affiliated clinics

Exclusion Criteria:

* Unable to undergo routine anoscopy
* Allergy or prior reaction to the fluorescent contrast agent Proflavine or Iodine
* Unable to give informed consent
* Current or prior history of Invasive Anal Cancer
* Known permanent or irreversible bleeding disorder, or other hematologic disorder that in the opinion of the investigator would place the patient at increased risk for adverse outcome from the procedure
* Pregnancy

primary.measure: Performance Characteristics: Sensitivity (SN), Specificity (SP), Positive Predictive Value (PPV) and Negative Predictive Values (NPV)
primary.description: The primary outcome of this study is to measure the operating characteristics including SN, SP, PPV and NPV comparing the physician- and algorithm- guided HRME-based image compared to the Lugol's- guided physician diagnosis of HSIL during HRA. Gold standard consensus pathology was used and pathology data needs to be obtained, verified, and entered.

secondary.description: Diagnostic yield: The number of neoplastic biopsies/total number of biopsies obtained in patients who received biopsies.
Total procedure time (HRA+HRME+biopsies) vs HRME time alone
